Daily Health Guidelines & Procedures: Students should stay home if they answer YES to any of the questions below:

-Do you have a temperature above 100*F?
-Do you have a loss of smell or taste?
-Do you have a headache?
-Do you have a sore throat?
-Do you have a persistent cough?
-Do you have difficulty breathing?
-Do you have digestive issues?
-Are you waiting for a COVID-19 test result?
-Have you been recently exposed to someone who has tested positive for COVID-19?

If you are experiencing these symptoms, you should stay home for:
-10 days after the onset of symptoms, AND
-24 hours fever free without medication, AND
-Other symptoms are improving.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

Bloom-Carroll Agriculture students made school history Saturday by placing 2nd in the State Novice Parliamentary Procedure Contest at the Ohio State University. Students were tested on Robert's Rules of Order and carried out a 15-minute demonstration of the parliamentary procedure.

"This group is a very impressive team of 8th and 9th graders who are well-spoken, poised and polished in running a business meeting. Thanks again to Amy Moore for coaching and to all the people who helped this team reach it's goal of putting a banner on the Bloom-Carroll FFA Wall of Fame!
Parliamentary Procedure has always been a cornerstone of FFA's leadership development so having a team excel in this competition has taken hours or hard work and dedication from this group of 8th and 9th graders. We are all in this together....Our students, their futures, our focus!" ~ Christi Bachman

In preparation for the winter months, we have created a page on our website that includes information regarding calamity days and blizzard bag assignments for the 2019-2020 school year.

What are Blizzard Bags?
Blizzard Bags are pre-designed lessons and activities that allow students to work from home in the case of a school closing.

State law allows school districts to use calamity make-up assignments/Blizzard Bags for up to the equivalent number of hours for three school days. The school hours missed do not count against the total number of hours required by law when make-up assignments/Blizzard Bags are utilized.

Students will be assigned Blizzard Bags on the 3rd, 5th, and 8th calamity day of the 2019-2020 school year.

All Blizzard Bag assignments are listed on our website by grade level so families can plan accordingly. Click here to view assignments.

https://www.bloom-carroll.k12.oh.us/CalamityDaysandBlizzardBags.aspx

October 21st - 25th is National School Bus Safety Week. This week is dedicated to promoting school bus safety to remind motors and students about the dangers that exist outside the school bus.

Some important bus rules include:
· Be at your designated bus stop 5 minutes before the scheduled pick up time.
· Go directly to your ASSIGNED seat.
· Remain seated and keep the aisles and exits clear.
· NO eating or drinking on the bus except when medically necessary.
· Keep head and hands out of the bus windows.

It is always important to pay attention to the driver. They are always checking mirrors for safety.

BCLSD Transportation Supervisor Carmen Spelmen would like to remind parents to make sure their house number is visible and on both sides of the mail box.

Below are some fun facts from our transportation department:

· 23 bus drivers
· 20 buses and 3 vans
· 1,789 number of students transported daily
· 433,538 miles driven annually
· 29,649 trip miles driven
· 63,094 gallons of fuel used annually

It's an exciting time for our kindergarten families! The first day of school is quickly approaching! :)

Please mark your calendar with the following dates and information regarding kindergarten:

The staggered start dates for kindergarten students will be August 28th & August 29th.

The first day for ALL kindergarten students to attend will be Friday, August 30th.

Incoming kindergarten students will receive a letter with an appointment time with the classroom teacher, as well as the staggered start date. Appointments will run throughout the day beginning August 22nd - 27th.

Looking forward to seeing you soon!

Ready for the new school year to begin? Be sure to complete all student forms, including the Transportation Request form in Final Forms. This form must be completed, even if you do not have a student who will be riding the bus this school year. Failure to complete the form may impact your student’s transportation.

If you have requested transportation, your bus driver will be calling you the week of August 12th with your bus number and pick-up/drop-off times.

If you have any questions, you can contact our Transportation Department at (614) 834-6706.
